intro: Luvunga eleutherandra var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eleutherandra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its habitat.
